caption: Qi Yan and Ka Hing are HTX engineers behind Project GIBSON. With a tap on their in-house built ride-hailing app, officers can call GIBSON, an indoor robot that operates in dual modes - autonomous or ride mode, to boost police presence and improve response times.

Mesh! is HTXs platform for engaging our network of partners and providing an opportunity to foster stronger collaborations, to advance science and technology for public safety. This year, we brought together 400 guests from 190 organisations, including government, industry, academia, foreign missions, and start-ups. We were honoured to have Mr Edwin Tong, Minister for Law and Second Minister for Home Affairs, grace the occasion.HTX is committed to building a vibrant ecosystem that bridges the public and private sectors across the entire innovation value chain.We aim to make an impact, together.HTXsg

At HTX, we believe our greatest strength lies not just in our people, but in the families who support them.Today, our Xponents and their loved ones came together for HTXs annual Family Day, an afternoon filled with play, laughter, and connection.We were also honoured to have Mr Edwin Tong SC, Minister for Law and Second Minister for Home Affairs, join us and experience the vibrant spirit of our agency. HTXsg FamilyDay

Our latest eXpresso! was more than just a town hall it was a reminder of what makes HTX fun and meaningful. Ties That Bind was the theme. We reflected on the camaraderie and teamwork of Xponents working tirelessly behind the scenes, such as at the recent General Elections, and pushing the frontiers of research.Xponents also had the opportunity to ask senior management any question - part of a continuous feedback loop to enhance initiatives and address employee concerns.This is part of how we shape our culture, and build support, trust, and collaboration, united by a shared purpose.HTXsg

If youve watched James Bond, youll know Q the genius behind all the cool tech. At HTX, our very own team of Qs drives rapid innovation to empower our Home Team officers.Wang Jiale is an AI engineer from HTXs Q Team Centre of Expertise. Like the iconic Q, he keeps a close eye on emerging tech trends and quickly prototypes solutions often within weeks to exponentially impact Singapores public safety and security.We operate like an agile startup, Jiale shares. Were always ahead of the curve, keeping pace with the industry and delivering impactful tech for the Home Team.Read more about Jia Les story on our website.Are you ready to be part of a mission-focused, tech-driven team? Apply now and make a real impact with HTX: AI TechXplore & Careers@ HTX on 26 & 27 May at Fusionopolis One (Atrium).HTXsg HTxAI WFH WorkforHTX Career

AI TechXplore & Careers is less than a week away! Discover how AI is transforming the Home Teamfrom enhancing public safety, saving lives to solving crimes and driving agility. Come see these projects in action at our booths and during on-stage demonstrations! Curious about an AI career in HTX? Speak to our friendly HR ambassadors and connect with HTX divisions that are hiring in R&D, Software Engineering, AI Masterplanning & Programme Management, and more. Dont miss our lunchtime talk on 27 May, 1-2pm, to discover why an AI career at HTX should be your next adventure. Attend tech talks to gain insights from leading AI experts and thought leaders on operationalising AI systems, ensuring AI performance, speech analytics, and more. Head down to AI TechXplore & Careers on: 26-27 May Fusionopolis One (Atrium) For more information: HTXsg HTxAI WFH WorkForHTX Careers

Aloysius Tan, Head of Cognitive Analytics, Cognitive Computing at HTXs xData division, shares that the freedom to innovate and work with diverse talents has been a key highlight of his career at HTX. He leads a team of AI scientists developing language-related artificial intelligence, including Speech-to-Text technology for use in radio communications and emergency calls to 999. Find out what it takes to thrive in an AI team filled with diverse talents and exciting opportunities on our website!Join Aloysius and build your AI career at HTX: HTxAI WorkForHTX WFH Careers

Driven by her childhood dream of saving lives, Priscilla Koh, an AI talent at HTX's Sensemaking & Surveillance Centre of Expertise, has found purpose and fulfilment in her work, where she advances life-saving efforts through AI innovation. One of her projects involved developing an AI tool to support marine rescue missions by identifying people at sea, overcoming challenges such as poor image quality and vessel movement. Beyond impactful work, Priscilla values HTXs strong commitment to professional growth. Read her story on our website!Join her and build your AI career at HTX: HTXsg HTxAI WFH Careers

Today, over 1,700 Xponents gathered for our annual HTX Convention with an energetic rallying cry: Score Big, Dream Bigger, Together!We kicked off on a high, setting the tone for a day of bold ideas and shared purpose then discussed how we plan to tackle tomorrows challenges together.From inspiring speeches by CE Chan Tsan and our Home Team leaders, to showcases of smart, autonomous systems (yeslive robots!), the Convention spotlighted how were accelerating tech deployment across the Home Team.We also announced new initiatives like the HTX Chat Bot, our AI push, and how HTSC and xCode are building agility and resilience.And of course, we celebrated the incredible efforts of fellow Xponents with the HTX Awards. Heres to shaping public safety and security together as One HTX.HTXsg HTXConvention

During the 's "Hell Week", HTX's Human Factors and Simulation Centre (HFS CoE) used heart rate monitors and ingestible thermometer pills to track trainees' physiological strain, enhancing training safety and effectiveness.By analysing real-time data, HFS CoE works with the Special Operations Group to optimize training intensity and duration, preparing officers for high-stress situations.This initiative highlights our dedication to leveraging science and technology to support frontline responders.htsg HTXplains ScienceAndTech HumanFactors TrainingSafety

HTX is charging the future of emergency response. With resonance charging, ambulances can easily power essential equipment such as medical refrigeration units simply by parking over a charging padno cables or perfect alignment needed. This smart solution reduces maintenance and delays, ensuring officers are always ready to respond swiftly to life-threatening situations.Aligned with Singapores Green Plan 2030, this wireless tech supports the transition to low-emission vehicles by 2040, paving the way for a sustainable future.Together, were engineering solutions that save lives and the planet. HTXsg HTXplains ScienceAndTech ResonanceCharging EmergencyResponse GreenTechnology FutureReady TechForGood

We recently concluded the HTX Annual Cycle 2024, and what a memorable ride it was!The event kicked off with a bicycle workshop where participants picked up essential tips to keep their rides in peak condition. This set the stage for an exciting 7-day challenge, where participants clocked distances at their own pacestaying active while building stronger connections along the way.This years Annual Cycle was particularly special, serving as a prelude to our 5th Anniversary celebrations.Adding to the excitement were the amazing prizes up for grabs. With five finisher milestones to achieve, participants were motivated to pedal harder as each milestone unlocked even more attractive rewards.Heres to the spirit of fitness, camaraderie, and fun that makes HTX truly special.HTXsg AnnualCycle2024 5thAnniversary

Last Friday, HTX celebrated its 5th anniversary with not one, but two events! In the morning, Xponents participated in a symbolic dash to HQ from eight satellite offices, mirroring how HTX was first formed in 2019 by bringing together talents from the various Home Team Departments and the Ministry of Home Affairs ( ).Later, over 1,500 Xponents gathered at Marina Bay Sands for a fun-filled dinner and dance themed Hands Across HTX.The event highlighted our journey in enhancing Singapores safety and security, as well as showcased the many innovations we have developed to exponentially empower the Home Team over the last five years.Wed like to extend a big THANK YOU to all Xponents, partners and stakeholderswe wouldnt have reached this milestone without your support.Heres to another five fruitful and eventful years ahead! Link in bio for the story. HTXsg 5thAnniversary OneHomeTeam

GLUE, GOAT, NGL, ROUGE, and SMHcan you tell which of these acronyms are evaluation metrics for Large Language Models (LLMs) and which are Gen Z slang? From training HTXs LLMs to understanding global practices on AI governance, our recent Responsible AI Day, organised by HTxAI Enterprise Group, highlighted the importance of integrating privacy, security, and governance to establish and operationalise robust responsible AI policies and practices.We were joined by Resaro, an independent third-party AI test lab, who shared global practices on AI Governance across jurisdictions and law enforcement agencies. Their presentation also touched on how AI systems can be tested to enhance performance and build user confidence.The event drew an engaged audience of about 200 participants attending both in-person and virtually. It concluded with a lively Q&A session.Find out more about what we do at HTX in the fields of data science and AI: HTXsg HTxAI LargeLanguageModel LLM ArtificialIntelligence AIp/s GLUE and ROUGE are evaluation metrics for LLMs.

Congratulations to all Xponents who received the National Day Award at this years Ministry of Home Affairs National Day Awards Investiture!These awards honour public officers for their exceptional contributions to Singapore, and were proud of the hard work and dedication our Xponents have put into force multiplying the Home Team. Here is our breakdown of the awards:- Commendation Medal: 7 recipients- Efficiency Medal: 6 recipients- Long Service Medal: 35 recipientsWant to learn more about the inspiring work these Xponents are doing? Discover their stories on our website and see how they are helping to build a safer and more secure Singapore. HTXsg NationalDayAwards

How do you prepare for the future while staying grounded in the present?Our Values Ambassador, Kee Ein Cern, strikes that perfect balance. By immersing himself in the day-to-day work of the Home Team, he ensures that his forward-looking ideas are grounded in real-world needs.At HTX, foresight is not just about preparing for the futureit is a core value that has driven us from the beginning, helping us secure Singapore with practical innovations that meet tomorrows challenges today.Curious about how Ein Cern wields foresight to shape the future of homeland security? Click here to find out more: HTXvalues Foresight

10 start-ups (Barricade AI, CLIKA Inc., Extreme Simulations, Graylark Technologies, LIVR , nami, Polygeist, SharkSense Ltd., SpectraCann, Voicesense) from six countries showcased their proof-of-concepts at the recent Demo Day held at Hatch.From automatic reporting using body-worn camera footage, to compression of large AI models, and hyper-realistic manikins for tactical medicine training, we got a glimpse of some of these solutions developed in collaboration with Home Team end-users and HTXs engineers.Dimension X is an open innovation challenge that accelerates and validates dual-use technologies from start-upstransforming bold ideas into impactful public safety and security solutions.HTXsg DimensionX Hatch Innovation PublicSafety StartupsHomelandSecurity

What a ride! After a series of intense pitching and presentations, the winner of HacX2024 was finally crowned.What is HacX? It is a hackathon jointly organised by HTX and , where young innovators are tasked with solving various challenge statementschallenges faced by Home Team Departments and HTXs Centres of Expertise. These range from safeguarding lives and properties to deterring and solving crimes, and enhancing safety for our frontline.The top 10 teams at the finals gave it their all for a shot at the grand prize of S$10,000. In the end, DataDream Team, Team REAct and Team Group 12 emerged as the top 3 winners, with DataDream Team clinching the grand prize.But it werent just the winners who impressed us with their solutionswe are proud of all the finalists who made it this far.From the semi-finals till now, we have witnessed the passion and unmistakable drive from all the teams to keep improving upon their solutions to keep Singapore safe and secure.Congratulations to the winners and everyone who participated!HTXsg Microsoft HacX Hackathon Innovation

These range from safeguarding lives and properties to deterring and solving crimes, and enhancing safety for our frontline.The top 10 teams at the finals gave it their all for a shot at the grand prize of S$10,000. In the end, DataDream Team, Team REAct and Team Group 12 emerged as the top 3 winners, with DataDream Team clinching the grand prize.But it werent just the winners who impressed us with their solutionswe are proud of all the finalists who made it this far.From the semi-finals till now, we have witnessed the passion and unmistakable drive from all the teams to keep improving upon their solutions to keep Singapore safe and secure.Congratulations to the winners and everyone who participated!HTXsg Microsoft HacX Hackathon Innovation

Thank you for having us, Raffles Girls School! As part of our outreach campaign, we brought our game room-on-wheelsthe HTXpressto a secondary school for the first time. We were glad that the students enjoyed venturing into the HTXpress and getting a sneak peek into the life of an Xponent. We also had a great time engaging with the students, sharing about the exciting future of homeland security and shedding some light on our scholarship and internship opportunities.HTXsg HTXpress

Wondering how to have more positive experiences at work?Meet Firhan, our Values Ambassador, who is on a mission to infuse HTX with exuberance and joy. His advice? Build strong connections, find purpose in what you do, and celebrate the little wins along the way.But how does exuberance help in the workplace? It doesnt just brighten your teams dayit creates a vibrant environment where innovation and collaboration can thrive. That is why at HTX, exuberance has been one of our core values, driving us forward since day one. Find out more about how Firhan brings joy to HTX: HTXvalues Exuberance

With deadlines to meet, it can be tough to find time to show care for others. But do you know that each small display of empathy can work wonders in building connections and delivering great work?According to our Values Ambassador, Jacqueline Chan, we could all use a bit of empathy. Empathy is not just about feeling sorry for someone, it is about understanding where they are coming from and why they make certain decisions. At HTX, empathy is one of our core values because it fuels innovation. By understanding each others perspectives, we spark fresh ideas and create better solutions together. Find out how Jacqueline keeps the cycle of care going at HTX: HTXValues Empathy

The semi-finals of HacX just wrapped and it was quite the show!We shortlisted 20 teams who have been working over the past few weeks to craft innovative solutions that enhance frontline safety, deter and solve crimes, as well as safeguard lives and properties.They brought their A-game and pitched their ideas to the judges to snag a place in the grand finals on 29 October. With only 10 finalist spots, the competition was fierce, and we were impressed by their creativity and enthusiasm.HTXsg Microsoft Innovation Hackathon HacX

Our latest eXpresso townhall truly lived up to its theme of sync, secure, celebrate.Everyone got in sync with updates across HTX including our new working on-the-go initiative and a thought-provoking session on current homeland security threats, shedding light on the challenges we are tackling.eXpresso was also a chance for Xponents to celebrate as we approach our 5th anniversary! Exciting news rolled in for the upcoming Dash, where Xponents will walk and cycle from all corners of Singapore and converge at HTX HQ. This journey leads into our much-anticipated dinner and dance, where Xponents will be able to snag some fun awards, like the coveted Best Dressed award!HTXsg HTScienceandTech Celebrate Townhall

These days, its getting trickier to know whats real and whats fake online.From spotting a deepfake video to detecting altered speech, AlchemiX can catch subtle signs of manipulation and address deepfakes effectively.At the Smart Nation 2.0 launch, where Prime Minister Lawrence Wong unveiled refreshed strategies for Singapores digital future, we highlighted how AI tools like AlchemiX play a big role in enhancing your everyday security.HTXsg SmartNationSG AI Deepfake

Meet the Blue Dolphin, a second-generation Marine Rescue Vessel (MRV) which will serve as a force multiplier for marine firefighting and rescue capabilities.But why the name "Blue Dolphin"?Well, SCDFs marine vessels are named after marine creatures. While smaller ones might carry names like "Swordfish" , this bigger fellow gets the "Dolphin" title !Developed in collaboration with SCDF, and , the Blue Dolphin has remarkedly improved capabilities compared with the MRV that came before it.From a customised fire monitor to a sonar for underwater search-and-rescue operations and advanced control system for propulsion, the Blue Dolphin will next undergo system commissioning and sea acceptance trials.Dive deeper into the Blue Dolphin story and the team behind it via the link in bio.HTXsg SCDF BlueDolphin

Xponents laced up and hit the roads at Yellow Ribbon Prison Run for a good cause. The run is an annual flagship event, part of the Yellow Ribbon Project. Celebrating its 20th anniversary this year, the project unites communities across Singapore to support the reintegration of inmates and ex-offenders by giving them second chances.HTX congratulates on reaching the milestone anniversary for this impactful initiative.HTXsg BeyondSecondChances SG4SecondChances YellowRibbonSingapore YRP20 YRPR24 YellowRibbonProject

From a medley of familiar songs celebrating Singapores 59th birthday, to teaser highlights of HTXs upcoming 5th anniversary celebrations, Xponents had a lot to cheer at our eXpresso townhall this month. We recognised our National Day Award recipients, impressive performances at the 32 Capture-the-Flag cybersecurity competitions, and winners of our annual walk-and-run, followed by a candid and engaging Ask Management Anything" session. Of course, we had to keep Xponents' bellies happy with hearty heartland food, because food is a national sport that we are all Not Alone In. HTXsg

We recognised our National Day Award recipients, impressive performances at the 32 Capture-the-Flag cybersecurity competitions, and winners of our annual walk-and-run, followed by a candid and engaging Ask Management Anything" session. Of course, we had to keep Xponents' bellies happy with hearty heartland food, because food is a national sport that we are all Not Alone In. HTXsg

Congratulations to Xponents from our xCyber division for their impressive performance at the recent DEF CON 32 "Capture the Flag" (CTF) competitions: 3rd in the Adversary Village and 5th in the Red Team Village!This showing at HTXs first DEF CON participation highlights our commitment to developing deep cyber capabilities in order to secure Singapore future, and validates our engineers abilities to safeguard critical Home Team systems.DEF CON is recognised by the international cybersecurity community as a top global gathering of ethical hackers. Each DEF CON village - including Adversary, Red Team, AI, IoT and Cloud - hosts its own CTF competition. In these white hat hacking events, skilled cybersecurity experts demonstrate their skill by uncovering hidden "flags" within intentionally vulnerable programs.HTXsg HTScienceandTech Cybersecurity DEFCON DEFCON32

And thats a wrap for the second eXpresso! session of the year! For this latest townhall, we picked up right where we left off, starting from the HTX Convention which took place in May, before reliving the good vibes of last months HTX Family and Sports Day. We also had fun icebreaker games during which Xponents got to know our new Leads better. Our new Xponent Values guidebook was also launched. In light of our new HTxAI movement, Xponents caught a glimpse of the exciting AI product demos that some of our teams are working on, including the new AI assistance application that will boost workplace productivity within HTX.We ended off with a round of Ask Management Anything (AMA) before refuelling with Project Refuel, an initiative that allows Xponents to mingle and connect over a hearty meal.Well be back with another shot of eXpresso! after National Day, so stay tuned!Is it that sweet? I guess so. Mm, thats that me eXpresso!. HTXsg

To everyone who showed up for the HTX career fair at Raffles Institution today thanks for making this event a blast!What happened? Our game room on wheels, HTXpress, was a hit as usual, and HTXs very own RI alumni were down at the event to inspire their juniors and give them the inside scoop on what a career with HTX looks like. Students also had the chance to learn about some of our exciting innovations that are used in bolstering homeland security.Looking to get a glimpse into a STEM career? HTX internship applications are open till 31 July 2024! More details at: HTScienceandTech Internship Careers

No man is an island. This is the mantra HTX has embraced since inception, and a key reason we have managed to grow our capabilities so quickly in just five years.At our inaugural Partners Appreciation Night yesterday, we recognised our partners hailing from some 129 organisations within Singapore and foreign governments, academic institutions and different industries who have worked tirelessly with us to push the boundaries of innovation.To all our esteemed partners, thank you for your support. Heres to many more years of friendship and meaningful collaborations to make Singapore more secure!Read more via the link in bio.HTXsg HTScienceandTech Partners

Yes, the shopping and food are great, but most people would agree that the most shiok feature of Changi Airport is its super-fast immigration clearance. Most of us clear immigration in a matter of seconds, and this is all thanks to the use of a biometric authentication system jointly designed by HTX, and How amazing is this system? Well, Changi Airport won the Worlds Best Immigration Service Award by Skytrax in April. Enough said! HTXSG HTScienceandTech

There might have been a downpour, but there was no stopping the outpour of laughter and joy at our recent Family & Sports Day!Held at Marina Barrage, the event brought Xponents from our different offices together and gave them the perfect opportunity to bond through fun activities and games.The Family & Sports Day also marked the launch of our Annual Walk and Run, which sees Xponents taking on one another in friendly competition as they try to outwalk or outrun one another over a week!HTXsg WorkCulture

Engineers from HTXs Robotics, Automation & Unmanned Systems (RAUS) Centre of Expertise took some time off from work to engage with teenage STEM enthusiasts and fan their flames of passion for science and tech at this years Robotics & Programming competition.Organised by College of Engineering (), the 11-13 June event also saw RAUS engineers share about their cutting-edge innovations that exponentially empower Home Team operations and enhance homeland security.The youths then got a chance to program and control a DJI Robomaster Robot for the competition. Talk about having a week to remember!Interested in pursuing a future in STEM? Be sure to check out our scholarship and internship opportunities.Make HTX the starting point of your exciting STEM journey!HTXsg HTScienceandTech Robotics Programming STEM

Last Friday, more than 1400 Xponents gathered for our annual HTX Convention. We recollected and celebrated our journey and growth together in the past four and a half years, and gained insights on core strategies for the future. These include harnessing AI as a game changer, as well as other novel ways of deepening skills and expertise to augment our Home Team operations to tackle homeland security threats. We also showed appreciation and recognition to 300+ Xponents for their valuable contributions in the past year! Heres to more collaborations, innovations and riding the next wave together, hand in hand! HTXsg HTScienceandTech HTXConvention

We are happy to share that HTX is named one of Singapores Best Employers 2024 by and for the second consecutive year! This award is a testament to our unwavering dedication to creating a workplace where fun meets purpose, nurturing the growth of every single one of our Xponents! Read more via the link in bio, about our Xponents, Chin Zhihao and Lydia He, on how they are given the training and space to develop their skills and grow.Let's keep pushing the boundaries and delivering excellence for our Home Team! HTXsg BestEmployer WorkCulture

Its a wrap for the inaugural Milipol Asia-Pacific - TechX Summit 2024 that was held in Singapore last week!There were meaningful partnerships forged, and fruitful discussions on how science and technologies like AI can be harnessed to overcome homeland security operational challenges. The strong participation at AI-CTF and great reception of innovations exhibited at HTX Pavilion demonstrate the excellence we can achieve with industry, academia and government leaders from the international homeland security community.We are pleased that MAP-TXS was such a resounding success! Kudos to Xponents who worked hard behind the scenes to make it all happen HTXsg HTScienceandTech TXS2024 Milipol2024

The theme of this years TechX Summit conference is AI and Homeland Security. It has been a great platform to gather insights from leaders in the government and industry; to learn about the latest technologies, solutions, and trends; generate discussions and exchange ideas; and to foster collaborations to make the world a safer place for everyone. We are proud to be co- organizers of this years Milipol Asia Pacific - TechX Summit. Read about our opening day on our website. Link in bio. HTXsg HTScienceandTech Partnerships TXS2024

We speak to two young STEM talents on their experience as booth presenters during the inaugural Milipol Asia-Pacific - TechX Summit 2024! Heres what Yi Di Yuan and Yeow Chien Tan have to say about the opportunity to share their units science and technology innovations while networking with more than 10,000 international delegates. For aspiring scientists and engineers, come meet our HTXsg HR colleagues and find out exciting career opportunities available now! Register in the link in our bio.Please note that event admission is for age 18 and above.TXS2024 HTXsg HTScienceandTech STEMCareers

We brought our mobile game room, HTXpress, down to Hwa Chong Institution on 28 February as part of our outreach programme. Our Xponents had a great time engaging HCI students, who were eager to learn about our work and explore career and scholarship opportunities with HTX. HTXpress will be heading to the Singapore Science & Engineering Fair (SSEF), happening at next week, on 6 March, Wednesday, at 12-6pm. Everyones invited, so join us there to experience HTXpress yourself!HTXSG Careers STEM

Long () time no see! Were back with the first eXpresso!, HTXs unique town hall event, of 2024. The event kicked off with a vibrant lion dance performance, and was attended by Xponents both in person at the new level 10 studio and online.Besides a nostalgic recap of 2023 and the introduction of new leadership, this eXpresso! was filled with much laughter and applause. Our sporting Directors dazzled everyone with their exuberant dragon dance and everyone had a blast during the games. Our management answered a series of questions during our usual AMA (Ask Management Anything), and we wrapped it all up with a lively lohei for good fortune and to scale to greater heights this dragon year!HTXsg CNY2024 chinesenewyear lunarnewyear yearofthedragon

HTXs innovation centre for public safety and security, Hatch, is the official innovation hub partner for The Big Spark, a brand-new reality TV series premiering on CNA tonight at 7pm to uncover the next big start-up, which will walk away with up to $1 million in seed funding. Together with partners, judges and contestants, we were treated to an exclusive sneak peek of the first episode of the show recently. Our Chief Executive, Mr Chan Tsan, sent his congratulations and highlighted Hatchs role in harnessing technologies from global start-ups for better Home Team operations.Dont forget to catch the first episode tonight!HTXsg HTXHatch Hatch Innovation TheBigSpark SparkBigDreams

Walkthrough scanners capable of detecting potential weaponsboth metal and non-metal in natureand drones that can be flown safely in urban conditions are just two of the innovative proof-of-concepts (POCs) developed by the first batch of global start-ups selected by Hatch, HTX's innovation center for public safety and security. These solutions were developed over the past six months in collaboration with our Home Team champions as part of Hatch's inaugural Open Innovation Challenge (OIC).Here are some highlights as we followed the start-ups from an abandoned warehouse to Marina East Park, where the start-ups brought their POCs to trial in the field for our Home Team departments. The field trials culminated in the OIC Demo Day held at Hatch, where these promising tech solutions were further presented to other stakeholders and industry partners.HTXsg HTScienceandTech Hatch Startups OpenInnovation DemoDay TechForGood PublicSafety Innovation

HTX wishes everyone a very happy and joyous new year!We kickstarted the year with a New Year party at our HQ last Friday, together with the official opening of our new office space at level 10. Besides yummy food, everyone also joined in activities such as an office-wide Scavenger Hunt, Floral Craft workshop, and DIY paper fan arts & craft.To a prosperous new year ahead, everyone!HTXsg HTScienceandTech newyear2024

Thats a wrap for Milipol Paris 2023, the largest Homeland Security exhibition in the world! It has been an eventful 3.5 days engaging over 2,000 visitors from around the globe at our SG Pavilion. Together with our partners, , and , we had the privilege of receiving the France Minister of Interior Grald Darmanin, Ivory Coast Interior Minister Vagondo Diomand, and our very own Minister of Home Affairs K Shanmugam. We were also joined by our Chairman, Aubeck Kam, who's concurrently the PS (Home Affairs Development), and the Commissioners of , and on this first-of-its-kind overseas mission. Thank you to the entire team of Xponents who worked tirelessly to make this event a success, both in Paris and Singapore! We'll see you next year at MAP-TXS 2024. Read more via link in bio.HTXsg MilipolParis2023

Bonjour! I am here at the biennial Milipol Paris 2023 to support our Singapore Pavilion! This is the first time HTX and its partners are exhibiting the latest technological innovations at this leading event, dedicated to homeland security. I had the honour of meeting Minister Shanmugam who flew in for this exposition. I also spoke with the capable team of engineers from HTX, NCS and ST Engineering, and was exponentially mind-blown by our solutions in Securing Borders, Saving Lives, Safeguarding Public Spaces, and the one closest to my heart Solving Crimes. My apartment in Paris was broken into and turned upside down on a bright and beautiful day in Spring last year. On that fateful day, everything changed for me. The trauma was twofold. First was the burglary itself, and second, the lack of a system robust enough to render the support you need when faced with threats and dangers. Burglary, like pickpocketing, are common transgressions and you just have to learn to live with the bad and the good that comes with living in a big city. Not having closure is the only closure I got. I realized how much we have taken safety and security for granted in Singapore. None of my friends have security alarm systems installed in their homes. I would also choose to believe that you wouldnt be able to get away scot-free if you commit any crimes in Singapore, no matter how petty your misdeeds are. You will be caught, in a very short time, or eventually. It is reassuring to know that so much effort goes into advancing science and technology for homeland security to keep Singapore safe. This to me, is the freedom the world needs. Freedom to be safe. MilipolParis

Our inspiring leaders united for a shared purpose today at the Women in HTX event. Many of them shared their personal stories to raise awareness about the importance of fostering gender inclusion and diversity in the workplace. They also talked about the many initiatives existing and upcoming that HTX has in place to make sure that women, who are usually underrepresented in the STEM industry, can be better supported at work. Were committed to this movement because brilliance knows no bounds.HTXsg ScienceandTech WomeninSTEM genderequality genderequity

The inaugural HacX! - Hack for Public Safety - jointly organised by HTX and brings together students from pre-university, polytechnic and university levels to harness the power of science and technology to solve crimes, secure borders, and reshape lives. Spanning across 5 weeks, the challenge saw nearly 100 team applications. From this pool, 35 teams were selected to participate in the semi-finals, and 10 teams made it to the finals held on 3 November. From these 10 groups, three winning teams were then chosen by the live audience and judges, and the first-prize winners walked home with $10,000!The participants demonstrated enthusiasm, creativity and innovation as they researched, conceptualised, developed, and pitched their solutions to the panel of judges. Throughout the journey, mentoring was also provided by our HomeTeam Departments and partner, Microsoft.What a great industry partnership to nurture the next generation of STEM talents in Singapore!HTXsg HTScienceandTech OneHomeTeam MicrosoftSingappre Technology Science Engineering

The keel laying ceremony for the Marine Rescue Vessel, Blue Dolphin, was held on 25 October, last Wednesday at Penguin Shipyard International Limited. We were joined by our colleagues, and at the signing and to witness the tag welding of the vessel.This joint collaboration led by HTX is part of our commitment to continuously develop cutting-edge capability road maps for the reinforcement of Maritime Security.The 2nd generation SCDF Marine Rescue Vessel (MRV2G), or Blue Dolphin, is a longer and more spacious vessel than its predecessor, with new features and capabilities, and more intuitive designs drawn from the experience of officers from the Marine Division.Read more via link in bio.HTXsg HTScienceandTech OneHomeTeam MarineSystems

Gotta hype ourselves up for our HTX Annual Cycle, though X seems to have a way to go. For this year's event, our Xponents are looking to clock a combined 65,000km over the next 10 days. Weapons of mass destruction may sound like they only exist in our Wildest Dreams, but our CBRNE* scientists know All Too Well that these silent threats can pose a serious risk to public safety.Anomalies in the air? I Knew You Were Trouble. Lavender Haze sighted? We cant just Shake It Off.Our team of CBRNE scientists develop cutting-edge technologies and work tirelessly at our network of checkpoint laboratories to ly detect and intercept unsuspecting threats from crossing our borders.* , , , , iykyk HTScienceandTech HTXsg

Congratulations to the finalists and winners of this years robotics competition! Since its inauguration in 2021, Ive witnessed how much the event has grown. Im heartened to see the students from NTU coming together every year to organise this event in hopes to carry their enthusiasm for robotics to the next generation of engineering talents. shared Cheng Wee Kiang, Director of HTXs Robotics, Automation and Unmanned Systems CoE, who once again graced the event finals as the Guest-of-Honor and presented the prizes to the winners.HTXsg HTScienceandTech Robotics

Innovation is a key driving force at HTX where we harness science and tech to augment the Home Team! Our scientists and engineers showcased some of the latest innovations during the recent TechXplore, a platform for our Home Team colleagues and industry partners to exchange insights and stay up to date with relevant S&T trends.We also welcomed the launch of Hatch, an innovation hub established by HTX to identify and accelerate dual use technologies for the homeland security space.Check out the photo story on these events for an insiders view on what went down! linkinbio HTXsg HTScienceandTech

Thank you Minister Shanmugam for launching Hatch officially last week! As the Home Teams force multiplier, theres a need for HTX to always be at the forefront of science and technology. Through Hatch, we focus on collaborations with start-ups and SMEs, to accelerate innovations with dual-use technologies for public safety and security.HTXsg HTScienceandTech Repost kshanmugam_ [Launch of Hatch]Launched Hatch, an innovation centre established by .Given the quick development of technology, HTX understands the need to work closely with startups and SMEs, many of which are at the forefront of the latest innovations.Through Hatch, HTX aims to accelerate and validate some early-stage innovations that leverage emerging technologies for homeland security.Hatch will run Open Innovation Challenges twice a year and invite start-ups from across all industries to take up these challenges. The start-ups will get to work directly with HT officers and HTX scientists and engineers. Funds will be given to selected start-ups to validate their technologies.Hatch is also looking at partnering start-ups from global innovation hubs like Silicon Valley and Tel Aviv to add to the growth and vibrancy of Singapores innovation ecosystem.OneHomeTeam HTScienceandTech

A picture is worth a thousand words, a video is worth even more - we can now share direct video streams from our mobile phones during emergency calls This is made possible with the Emergency Video System (EVS) which was jointly launched last week by SPF, SCDF and HTX. Various HTX divisions were involved to offer their expertise, including the Policing and Civil Defence Programme Management Centres (PMCs) and xCloud.The biggest challenge was in ensuring the system operates in a secured landscape while making it convenient for officers and callers. shared Serene Tan, an engineer from HTXs Policing PMC.Learn more about the EVS via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech

Innovation is in motion at HTX! Yesterday, we gathered for our inaugural HTX Convention. It was a special town hall session to not only share about HTXs upcoming initiatives, but to also spark and drive innovation within the HTX community. From sharing personal experiences of innovation in the workplace, to pitches showcasing out-of-the-box thinking, we were certainly inspired to innovate fearlessly with the aim of keeping our homeland safe and secure through science & tech!HTXsg HTScienceandTech Innovation

A new emergency video system allows those calling 999 or 995 to provide operators a live stream of the situation from their mobile phones.Jointly developed by HTX, and , the system will aid operators in situational assessment and decision-making, especially ones that involve more complex situations, where the caller might not be able to accurately describe what is happening.The system can also be initiated for incidents when the caller is unable to provide the exact location of an emergency, especially in remote areas such as nature reserves or certain roads and expressways.Read the full story via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech OneHomeTeam

We recently had the pleasure of hosting Dr. Dimitri Kusnezov, Under Secretary for Science and Technology, U.S. Department of Homeland Security Science and Technology Directorate, and his colleagues, where we showcased our latest innovations and breakthroughs for the Home Team. We are thrilled that our guests were impressed by our teams expertise and passion for pushing the boundaries to tackle challenges in homeland security. We are also grateful for the opportunity to share our vision with our esteemed guests and look forward to continuing our mission to make a positive impact on Singapores safety and security through science and technology. Stay tuned for more updates on our groundbreaking work!HTXsgHTScienceandTechInnovationpushingboundaries

Thank you Singapore Science and Engineering Fair for having us yesterday!Ever-committed to nurturing young STEM talents, Tan Teck Chuan (Director of HTX Platform Systems) once again sat on the judging panel as in previous years, to offer his expertise and inspire the participants. Dr Yuan Yi Di, scientist at HTXs Disruptive Technologies Office, spoke at the event to share more about the computational methods used by HTX scientists to identify unknown drugs so as to secure our borders.We also came bearing gifts (i.e. fun activities!) Not only did we activate the maiden visit of HTXpress, an interactive gamified experience customised for the students, we also brought along our robotic dog where a number of students were thrilled to walk it! Through these activities, the students were able to learn more about HTXs work and impact on homeland security.HTXsg HTScienceandTech SSEF2023

These were questions Hong Yuan was often asked as a student, having chosen to pursue Mathematics in university.Through his university course, he came into contact with coding fundamentals, which went on to spark an interest in software engineering and led him to venture into computer vision and data analytics.Now, he is an AI engineer working on solutions that impact homeland security. Wishing all engineers, a very happy WorldEngineeringDay!HTXsg HTScienceandTech Engineering

She enjoys puzzles - and the human brain is one very fascinating puzzle to her. From the stories we tell ourselves, to the stories we tell others, from how we perceive this world, to how the world perceives us - these are questions that drove Jennifer to delve deeper into psychology, neuroscience and cognitive science. I am lucky to be able to work in a field that Im interested in, and to have my work applied to help support the Home Team in keeping Singapore safe and secure.This International Day of Women and Girls in Science, we celebrate them! We speak to one of ours - Jennifer Ang, a human factors scientist, to hear about her experience. Swipe to read! HTXsg HTScienceandTech IDWGIS Science WomenInScience STEM

You may be familiar with recreational UAVs. But the Beyond Visual Line of Sight (BVLOS) technology that we leverage for our Home Teams deployment of UAVs in the near future takes it a step further.Leveraging BVLOS technology means our UAVs can be controlled and monitored remotely from within a Command Centre. This will project police presence and augment manned patrols as well as provide wider area surveillance capability.BVLOS UAVs can also be used as first responders to emergencies by providing a situational picture of incident sites, such as major fires or terrorist attacks. As the Home Team force multiplier, HTX continues to leverage technology to enhance Home Team operations to keep Singapore safe and secure.Learn more about the BVLOS technology via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech UAV Drone BVLOS

Singapore enjoys clean air, but periodically, SCDF receives calls from the public alerting them to unidentifiable smells in various parts of the island which may pose a potential hazard to the public. That's where eNose comes in. Our network of sensors serve as an early-warning detection system to remotely detect hazardous fumes, and enable our frontline to execute mitigation measures much more quickly. Learn about eNose via the link in bio! HTXsg ForceMultiplier EnhancingPublicSafety

Wheelchair travellers and families of up to four can now clear immigration via new automated lanes instead of through manual counters.HTX worked closely with , leveraging virtual reality simulations as well as design thinking workshops to address challenges that may be faced in Special Assistance Lanes, taking into consideration the placement and angles of the biometric scanners as well as the width of the lanes. With more travellers clearing immigration through automated lanes, ICA officers can be better deployed to take on enhanced job roles, focusing on border security functions such as profiling, assessment, and investigation work.Read the full story via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech Technology Biometrics[Photo credits: ICA]

The Prison Automated Screening System (PASS) not only improves operational efficiency via its automation and deep learning technologies, it also aims to better facilitate supervisees reintegration into society.Watch the video for a closer look at the features of PASS and hear from the people behind this innovative use of technology! Full story via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech Automation Robotics

Developed by HTX engineers with , the Prison Automated Screening System (PASS) enables more convenient drug screening tests for ex-offenders on their journey to reintegration.Integrating robotics, sensors and deep learning technology, the system is able to identify and prevent attempts of foul play.Currently on trial at Selarang Park Community Supervision Centre till February 2024, PASS not only reduces manpower but also time required for urine tests.Check out the full coverage via the link in bio! HTXsg HTScienceandTech

It has been an eventful 10 days and we are ending our celebratory activities on a high note! Following our 3rd Anniversary lunch and TechXplore showcase, our Xponents family and loved ones were invited to an Open House where they learnt more about the work we do through fun and engaging activities. Get a glimpse of what went on via our story highlights! We also flagged off our Annual Walk & Run event yesterday, with 700 Xponents clocking steps from various parts of Singapore to HTX HQ Not only were we energised by the company of our colleagues, it was also a reminder for us to stay active and healthy! Read about it via the linkinbio We hope everyone enjoyed themselves and are fully rejuvenated! We look forward to greater accomplishments and achievements in our next year HTXsg HTScienceandTech HTXturns3

Thank you DPM for joining us at TechXplore! It has been 3 years since HTX was formed to advance Science and Tech so as to innovate solutions that augment our Home Teams operations.Earlier this week, we invited our Home Team and relevant agencies to our 4th edition of TechXplore to check out the latest research and technologies that could potentially enhance homeland security. From unmanned surface vessels that aid firefighting operations to indoor unmanned aerial vehicles, to biosurveillance tools, learn more about some of the tech showcased via the link in bio! HTXsg HTScienceandTech HTXturns3

With close to 20 years of experience in the field of digital forensics, Sim Lai Hua has witnessed how quickly technology has evolved and the impact it has had on crime solving. One of the cases he worked on was the Little India riot incident, where the team was activated to support the processing of hundreds of exhibits and providing expert technical consultancy.As an award recipient of the Ministry of Home Affairs National Day Awards (MNDA), Lai Hua was recently interviewed by Lianhe Zaobao, where he shared more about his work and how digital tools like the Digital Forensic Kiosk play a part in solving criminal cases. Keen to learn more about these tools? Check out via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech DigitalForensics

Have you got something to hide? When it comes to emergency response, every second counts Introducing the Automated Medical Store concept, a collaborative effort between HTX and . Powered by sensors and facial recognition technology, we replace the traditional process of updating inventory records with pen and paper to a self-checkout system. Our paramedics can restock their ambulances more quickly and this translates to more efficient life-saving operations! Learn more about the Automated Medical Store via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech FacialRecognition

How long do you think it takes to detect controlled substances in the blood, urine or sweat specimens from suspects? While this used to take several days in a lab, thanks to technology, detection of controlled substances can now be done within minutes using just sweat , on-site or at the crime scene!This was shared by HTXs Chief Forensic Scientist, Dr Michael Tay, at an industry sharing event organised by . With over 30 years of experience in the forensics field, Dr Tay spoke about trends and an exciting career in forensics, where forensic scientists are increasingly exploring new technologies and adopting a cross-disciplinary, collaborative approach to solve crime.Read more about Dr Tays sharing and insights via the linkinbio ForensicsHTXsg HTScienceandTech

October is CybersecurityAwarenessMonth!From border control, public safety to emergency response, we work closely as OneHomeTeam to keep Singapore safe and secure. Home Team systems are crucial to daily operations and the stakes are high. So how do we safeguard data and systems from cyber threats?At HTX, our engineers need to always stay one step ahead, innovating new cybersecurity capabilities to fortify our systems while proactively identifying any potential security vulnerabilities. Interested in pursuing a career with us in cybersecurity (or other S&T fields)? Join us. linkinbio HTXsg HTScienceandTech Cybersecurity

Leong Hin Fong is no ordinary scientist - from donning bullet-resistant vests and bunker gear, to zipping around in watercraft at high speeds, she has done them all as part of her work to optimise the safety and performance of our frontline in Home Team operations.As a senior scientist with HTXs Human Factors & Simulation CoE, Hin Fong also played a key role in setting up the recently launched EXCEL facility jointly developed by HTX and SCDF. Starting today, the Robotic Escort & Security System (RESS) will be on trial at the Tuas Checkpoint. Conceptualised by engineers from HTX's Robotics, Automation and Unmanned Systems Centre of Expertise (RAUS CoE), this robot escort uses video analytics and environment sensors to self-navigate and guide travellers requiring further assistance from the immigration counters to secondary office areas. "The RESS live trials will provide valuable insights on how the use of robots and automation can enhance 's operations, to enable a safer and more seamless immigration clearance experience," shared Ong Ka Hing, Deputy Director, RAUS CoE. The trial ends on 11 November 2022.Find out more via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech Robotics Automation OneHomeTeam

Presented with the mission to address real-world challenges faced by the Home Team, students from came up with some innovative robotic solutions under the mentorship of our HTX engineers! Among these solutions were A.L.A.N., an autonomous parachute system for safe landing of malfunctioned drones, as well as SLEEK, a soft robot that can brave rubble and rough terrains during search-and-rescue missions.We believe in doing our part to nurture the young robotics and automation talent in Singapore. It is heartening to see young talents from different engineering disciplinary backgrounds come together to solve real world problems in line with HTXs mission, said Cheng Wee Kiang, Director, RAUS Centre of Expertise.Learn more about the exciting projects via the link in bio! HTXsg HTScienceandTech robotics SUTDCapstone

We are grateful to receive the Public Sector Transformation (PST) Exemplary Innovator Award alongside , , and .sg! This award for the multi-agency collaboration recognises the innovative work that went into developing OMNII, a transformative digital platform that allows SCDF and hospitals to work together in an integrated manner so as to enhance the delivery of emergency medical services. Future phases of OMNII may include biometric authentication to identify patients and cloud-based AI technology for more intelligent operations and clinical treatment. OMNII is a great testament of a multi-agency, cross-ministry project that embraces technology to bring about higher efficiency and better outcomes for both users and the people we serve, said Ling Kok Yong, Director, HTXs Civil Defence Programme Management Centre (CDPMC). Find out more about OMNII via the link in bio

This mini is a rather mighty robot that will enable faster and safer operations for homeland security.HTXs Q Team engineers have conducted extensive fieldwork to develop MiniX, which can be customised to fit the Home Teams operational needs. MiniX is testament to the agility, innovativeness, and passion that Q Team engineers have, Ng Gee Wah, Director of Q Team, said. We are proud to do our part in homeland security and look forward to seeing MiniX unleash its power as a force multiplier for Home Teams operations. Learn more about the team and the tech behind MiniX via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech

Developed in-house by HTXs Q Team engineers, MiniX is a highly customisable robot that augments Police Security Command officers in conducting surveillance of underground facilities and tunnels before large-scale events.Not only is it able to traverse different terrains like thick mud, flooded environments, or tight tunnels, MiniX also uses AI-powered video analytics to detect and alert officers about suspicious objects.Read the full story via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech

Recently, our engineers from Human Factors & Simulation Centre of Expertise showcased HTXs innovative mixed reality (MR) training system for bloodstain pattern analysis (BPA) at the Technology & Courts of the Future 2022 programme conducted by the Singapore Judicial College under the Singapore Cooperation Programme.By employing holographic projections to create realistic and configurable virtual crime scenes, the MR BPA training system addresses the limitations of conventional training methods that are usually time-consuming and labour-intensive.Learn more about the tech via the link in bio [Photo Credits: Singapore Cooperation Programme]HTXsg HTScienceandTech MixedReality HumanFactors ScienceandTechnology

Thank you Minister , MOS .xueling, members of GPC for Home Affairs and MPs who joined us yesterday to cycle for a good cause! This is part of HTXs Annual Cycle organised to encourage Xponents to lead a healthy lifestyle while having fun and building camaraderie with colleagues. This year, Xponents can also take part in a CSR challenge where teams have to complete a target distance of 2022km in 10 days, to help raise funds for .This event is a special one, as it is the first time HTX is partnering with a charity. (Engineering Goods) missions are very aligned with HTX, because we are all about science and technology, and using it to do good, said HTX Chief Executive Chan Tsan, during the flag-off where two hundred HTX cyclists gathered to kickstart the event last Friday.Read about the ride via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech OneHomeTeam DoingGood SGCares NDP2022 CityofGood CompanyofGood Cheng Li Hui

Over 1,000 Xponents had a chance to Ask Minister Anything during a special eXpresso! (HTXs bi-monthly townhall) held earlier this month.Thank you Minister for an insightful and engaging dialogue session at our newly-renovated office, sharing your personal anecdotes, as well as responding to questions close to Xponents hearts! HTXsg OneHomeTeamRepost [HTXs eXpresso!]I joined HTXs eXpresso!, its bi-monthly town hall.We had a candid chat on several topics where I shared my views.One question posed to me was, which Marvel or DC character do I think best represents HTX? Batman was suggested, but I think HTX is more like Robin. Not a side-kick, but one that plays a crucial role in supporting the work of our Home Team Departments.I encouraged HTX officers to continue pushing the boundaries of Science and Technology, to transform and enhance our homeland security.OneHomeTeam Ministry of Home Affairs, Singapore HTXSG

This International WomeninEngineering Day, we cast the spotlight on Shirley Chow, Director of HTXs Data Science and AI (DSAI) CoE, who shares with us her career and journey.She lets us in on how purpose motivates her. Im drawn to the Home Teams mission. Being able to contribute to Singapores safety and security through technology brings me immense satisfaction, Shirley said.On whether she faced any difficulties as a woman in engineering, Shirley tells us that she has never let her gender define her work and achievements. In engineering, it is about head - the knowledge and skills you have - and heart - the courage to step out and try new things.Check out the full interview via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech INWED DataScience ArtificialIntelligence AI

ICYMI | Jointly developed by and , the new Emergency Responders Fitness Conditioning and Enhancement Lab (EXCEL) was officially opened by MOS during SCDFs workplan seminar last week!This purpose-built R&D and training facility will enable us to further our research on emergency responder performance to develop new training paradigms that challenge existing norms and further push limits of human performance to enhance the operational readiness of our Home Team officers, said Ying Meng Fai, Director of HTXs Human Factors & Simulation CoE.Take a closer look at how EXCEL can redefine responders performance through ScienceandTechnology via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech HumanFactors

Feeling the heat lately? Imagine what our Home Team uniformed officers go through! The warm weather may increase our frontline officers risk of fatigue and even injury due to heat exhaustion. One of the areas our HTXs Human Factors & Simulation CoE explores is the use of human factor science to optimise the design of the suits, tactical gear and daily operational wear worn by officers so as to reduce that risk. Another research breakthrough was to customise a novel moisture-trapping material for practical applications to enhance the performance of frontline officers, which could remarkably lower the likelihood of heat stroke. Check out the story via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech

Congratulations to the 237 promoted HTX officers (our Xponents) and recipients of 50 HTX Awards! HTX plays a key role in Singapores homeland security ecosystem and can help build a safer tomorrow for Singapore. Xponents are the key to what we can achieve, said Chan Tsan, Chief Executive of HTX, during his speech at the HTX Promotion and Awards Ceremony held yesterday.We are proud to celebrate the achievements and contributions of our Xponents who have pushed the boundaries of science and tech with their innovativeness, teamwork and sense of mission.Read more via the link in bio. HTXsg HTScienceandTech

Over the past few days, our Xponents took some time to have a bit of fun and recharge at our HTX Carnival , organised by our very own Healthy Lifestyle Committee! Not only did we receive snacks and souvenirs after enjoying the nostalgic carnival games, we had the chance to bond with our co-workers outside of work. We also had the chance to learn about the passions of colleagues through interest groups like Tabletop Wargaming, which provided many with a hands-on and therapeutic experience of painting miniature models, while the Cycling Community of Interest spurred on some friendly competition with a stationary bike challenge. We hope everyone had a great time! Happy Friday and have a rejuvenating weekend! HTXsg

With rapid advancements in ScienceandTechnology, we need to better prepare ourselves for tomorrows threats. This is where our team of passionate researchers from HTXs Disruptive Technologies Office (DTO) come in venturing into emerging S&T capabilities to augment the Home Teams objective of keeping Singapore safe and secure. This includes quantum technologies, which are the focus of Senior Scientist Sivakumar M. Maniams work. Swipe to hear from him! To all quantum scientists and engineers, happy WorldQuantumDay! HTXsg HTScienceandTech STEM

Healthcare workers and other frontline officers often don protective suits for long hours, causing discomfort and prolonged thermal strain.Combining the teams scientific knowledge of advanced hydrogel materials and HTXs engineering capabilities and deep understanding of the Home Teams needs, the joint research team was able to customise and optimise the novel moisture-trapping material for practical applications to enhance performance of frontline officers.Check out the full story via the link in bio [Photo Credits: NUS and HTX]HTXsg HTScienceandTech ScienceandTechnology

Healthcare workers and other frontline officers often don protective suits for long hours, causing discomfort and prolonged thermal strain.Combining the teams scientific knowledge of advanced hydrogel materials and HTXs engineering capabilities and deep understanding of the Home Teams needs, the joint research team was able to customise and optimise the novel moisture-trapping material for practical applications to enhance performance of frontline officers.Check out the full story via the link in bio [Photo Credits: NUS and HTX]HTXsg HTScienceandTech ScienceandTechnology

Whether it was the Huang Na murder case a tragic case that gripped the entire nation in 2004 or other high-profile cases like the Eu Lim Hoklai or Yishun Triple Murder, Lim Chin Chin had worked on them during her illustrious career in forensics. Over the past 26 years, she has not only witnessed how rapidly the field has advanced, but has also been personally involved in driving many of the breakthrough projects that helped shaped the forensic capabilities of today. Chin Chin shares with us her career journey thus far, and her plans as Director of HTXs Forensics Centre of Expertise check out her full story via the link in bio Shout out to our HTX women scientists and engineers for their achievements, and happy InternationalWomensDay! HTXsg HTScienceandTech Forensics theHTXfamily

Happy World Engineering Day! Did you know that engineers at HTX work on diverse projects, from robotics to leading-edge vehicular platforms? As an engineer of HTXs Land Systems Centre of Expertise, Trevor Heung works on vehicular platforms that empower the Home Teams frontline operations. This includes an automated vehicle project at Changi Prison Complex for and the Next-generation Fast Response Car for . Through HTX, I can come up with S&T solutions that impact the entire Home Team. My sense of purpose has never wavered, and has in fact grown even stronger over the years." Travel with Trevor on the autonomous vehicle project and his journey in HTX via the link in bio! HTXsg HTScienceandTech WorldEngineeringDay

Congratulations to the HTXIC2021 winners! The HTXIC Prize-giving Ceremony was held yesterday in recognition of the winning teams achievements. We were pleasantly surprised that our efforts during the challenge were well-rewarded! shared 23 year old VS Ragul Balaj, team leader of T0X1C V4P0R. We havent participated in a CTF in a while and it was refreshing to see (challenges) that were not purely cyber-related. Thank you once again for the support and participation at HTXIC2021! We hope you have gained some appreciation of HTXs work and the STEM applications in various domains that can enhance Homeland Security, and will continue pursuing your passions in STEM! Find out more about the winning teams and their experience in HTXIC via the link in bio HTXsg HTScienceandTech

Thank you MOS for visiting the Protective, Analytical and Assessment Facility (PAAF) at Pasir Panjang Scanning Station on New Years Day 2022! Working closely with , our CBRNE scientists at PAAF play a key role in securing Singapores borders. Aside from employing the latest technologies to detect and deter hazardous materials in cargo shipments from entering our shores, our scientists also conduct checks and tests as part of biosurveillance, to intercept and counter invisible threats such as viruses and pathogens! Learn more about CBRNE Centre of Expertise via the link in bio. Repost Visited ICA officers at Changi Airfreight Centre and Pasir Panjang Scanning Station on New Years Day. At Changi Airfreight Centre, the officers brought me around to view our clearance booths. Due to the pandemic, more consumers have turned to online shopping for necessities, leisure and even groceries. Air cargo checkpoints have experienced a significant increase in volume of low value e-commerce. In 2020, ICA cleared over 21 million low-value goods through the air cargo checkpoints, which is double from the 10.5 million cleared in 2019. ICA also works closely with CAAS, MOH, Singapore Customs, HSA, SATS and authorised freight forwarders on vaccine imports, clearance and transportation through the air cargo checkpoints. Given that the vaccines have to be stored in very low temperatures, ICA ensures that the clearance process does not undermine the efficacy or delay the vaccine importation. At Pasir Panjang Scanning Station, ICA officers demonstrated how anomalies are detected during cargo inspection. Thank you ICA, for keeping our borders safe and secure. Wishing everyone a joyous start to 2022. GuardiansOfOurBorders OneHomeTeam HTXsg HTScienceandTech

Thank you Minister .ylm for supporting our inaugural HTX Investigators Challenge! Apart from the sense of achievement that came with every solved challenge, we hope participants also went away with a better understanding of how the engineers and scientists at HTXsg leverage Science and Technology to augment the Home Team frontline in keeping Singapore safe and secure. Find out more about what went down at HTXIC via the link in bio! HTScienceandTechRepost .ylm This year marks the inaugural HTX Investigators Challenge (HTXIC).I am heartened to see so many youths come together to pit their wits and skills against one another in the Capture-the-Flag (CTF) event, where groups of participants compete in a customised gamified challenge arena virtually.Unlike other CTF events, HTXIC is a first of its kind event filled with challenges beyond the usual cybersecurity domain. It also involves the science and engineering domains which focus on safety and security areas that are under the Home Teams purview. Science and technology innovations are essential in augmenting our Home Teams efforts to ensure operational efficiency and safety of our officers.I hope that such events will help to groom more talents and allow them to discover their fullest potential, thereby contributing to a SmartNation and a safer Singapore.Lastly, congratulations to the winning team of the first HTX Investigators Challenge T0X1C V4P0R. And to the rest of the teams, great work! - Jo TeoOneHomeTeam

We are very pleased with the overwhelming response and registrations for our inaugural HTX Investigators Challenge (HTXIC)! While we eagerly await the event on 20 Dec, lets hear from one of the HTXIC2021 judges to find out what they are looking forward to! With research interests in cybersecurity, artificialintelligence, and quantumphysics, Jonathan Pan, Chief of Disruptive Technologies Office (DTO) brings with him his experience in eXploring new opportunities and innovative methods to keep Singapore safe and secure. We look forward to his contribution as an HTXIC2021 judge! Find out more via the link in bio HTXSG ScienceandTechnology HTXIC

HTX turns 2 today! Swipe to follow us on a walk down memory lane and relive some of our 2021 highlights! Staying true to our mission, we harnessed S&T solutions to exponentially impact Singapores safety and security. We shared at international platforms and connected with industry partners to learn, collaborate and innovate together, to advance S&T capabilities.We worked hard, but we also played hard - building a vibrant and nurturing organization together! Fancy a view from a Police Coast Guard patrol boat? except this isnt an actual boat! This is the view from inside the Tactical Boat Handling and Firing Simulator (TBHFS) the first of its kind in Singapore which was recently covered in the news again. Along with technologies such as an advanced eye-tracking system and weapon capabilities, it enables highly realistic vessel simulation which allows Police Coast Guard officers to practise high-risk manoeuvres and experience different scenarios in a safe and controlled environment. Swipe to see how the simulator looks from the outside Water you waiting for? Read more via the link in bio HTXsg ScienceandTechnology Simulation

What captures both iris and facial biometrics simultaneously to authenticate the identity of travellers at our checkpoints? Being progressively rolled out at Singapore's immigration checkpoints, the Multi-modal Biometrics System (MMBS) makes use of iris scans to not only make clearance more efficient, but more secure as well. With fingerprints prone to fading due to ageing, scarring or dryness, this contactless border clearance system means iris scans will replace fingerprints as the primary biometric identifier! Learn more about the collaboration between HTX and via the link in bio! HTXsg HTScienceandTech Biometrics

Like its namesake in the James Bond films, HTXs Q Team takes on unconventional challenges and embarks on rapid prototyping to develop innovative solutions! This team takes on multi-disciplinary projects ranging from cybersecurity to data analytics to robotics. One such project is the recently reported Online Cybersquat Hunter (OCH) which is able to identify and take down fake websites, using AI with image and text analytics. Check out the OCH project via the link in bio! HTXSG ScienceandTech

To secure our borders, officers at the checkpoints will need to identify persons-of-interest trying to enter or leave Singapore amongst the hundreds or thousands travelling. This is akin to searching for a needle in a haystack! How do we leverage technology to identify persons-of-interest efficiently and accurately? Swipe to find out! HTXsg ScienceandTech Biometrics FacialRecognition VideoAnalytics HTXProblemStatement

How do we empower investigators to quickly and easily recover and process digital evidence? Swipe to find out! HTXsg ScienceandTech DigitalForensics HTXProblemStatement

Lifting a vessel out of water may seem like a Herculean task, but less so with the experience and expertise of our engineers. Patrol boats are deployed to safeguard our waters. To ensure the safety of our Police Coast Guard officers and to maximise operational efficiencies, our engineers work tirelessly behind-the-scenes to carry out routine maintenance on the patrol boats. This includes underwater hull cleaning and regular maintenance of the boat's machinery and systems, which requires hoisting it out of water and bringing it to land.HTXsg ScienceandTech

Hope everyone is staying afloat and healthy during these trying times! Like us, machines and systems should not be overworked, and require regular maintenance to prevent break downs. Even as most of us may be working from home, our Platform Systems engineers need to be on site to conduct regular health check-ups for patrol boats, to ensure that the systems are working well for efficient operations and the safety of patrol officers onboard when they are out at sea. HTXsg ScienceandTech

What does it mean to keep the lights on when it pertains to Singapores safety and security? This involves ensuring that operating systems like 995/999 emergency calls and immigration clearance systems are performing optimally round the clock. While most of us are working from home this period, our colleagues from HTX Operations Systems are working quietly behind the scenes to provide support for the operational systems of our Home Team Departments (HTDs) to keep them secure against cyber-attacks through monitoring and response from our in-house Security Ops Centre. HTXsg ScienceandTech Cybersecurity

Thank you MOS Desmond for visiting us at TechXplore! Through our TechXplore platform, we hope to showcase and share the latest science, engineering, digital capabilities and innovations with our HTX family and relevant colleagues in the public sector, that could enhance Home Team operations. We'll continue to the sciences and with the latest technologies in order to impact Singapore's safety and security.Repost Visited HTX TechXplore last week at the new HTX HQ Campus. Was impressed by the suite of Science & Tech capabilities that HTX is building up with its blend of experienced and young engineering talents. Can sense their passion and excitement to develop cutting edge solutions in support of the Home Team. Counter drones, data analytics, forensics, first aid response, etc, are some examples of exciting tech and digital solutions developed in house or tailored to needs. With increased pressure to meet higher ops tempo, coupled with manpower constraints, technology is a key multiplier to improve home teams operational effectiveness. mha htxsg

The Tactical Boat Handling and Firing Simulator (TBHFS) is one of HTXs collaborations with . It provides a myriad of training scenarios, and duplicates how the vessel behaves when affected by real-world factors like wave movements and various sea states. Multiple sensors, including an eye tracker system, allow trainers to provide more targeted feedback for areas of improvement. With application of sophisticated technologies, Police Coast Guard (PCG) officers can hone their skills in a safer environment before embarking on live training out at sea. Find out more about the simulator and its capabilities via the link in bio!

The Tactical Boat Handling and Firing Simulator (TBHFS) is one of HTXs collaborations with . It provides a myriad of training scenarios, and duplicates how the vessel behaves when affected by real-world factors like wave movements and various sea states. Multiple sensors, including an eye tracker system, allow trainers to provide more targeted feedback for areas of improvement. With application of sophisticated technologies, Police Coast Guard (PCG) officers can hone their skills in a safer environment before embarking on live training out at sea. Find out more about the simulator and its capabilities via the link in bio!

When it comes to preparing our Home Team frontline officers for dangerous and demanding missions, not only is their physical safety important, but equally so, is their mental ability to manage the cognitive load required. This is why the Human Factors & Simulation Centre of Expertise (HF&S CoE) is exploring the use of S&T for adaptive workspaces in operation centres and training.With the EEG (electroencephalogram) headbands real-time measurement and monitoring of human performance indicators, it is possible to actively anticipate and adjust the work environment, task assignment or training level to better match an officers dynamic condition and needs. Swipe to watch a short video!At HTXsg, we always strive to be at the forefront of technology so as to harness it for our frontline to eXcel in their operations. Learn more about HF&S CoE via the link in bio.ScienceandTech MentalHealth

Over the past couple of days, the inaugural TechXplore was organised by HTXsg to showcase thelatestR&D and HTScienceandTech innovations that can be applied to enhance our homeland security.Aside from senior management and colleagues, a number of our colleagues from Home Team Departments who were eager to learn and explore these new technologies also dropped by! HTX officers fromseveral Centres of Expertise(CoEs)and Programme Management Centres (PMCs) such as Biometrics & Profiling (B&P), Forensics,Sense-making and Surveillance (S&S) and Trials and Experimentationwere amongstthosewhosharedabout the transformative tech which can enhance our Home Teams operations.We hope theshowcasehas beenexciting for our attendees and that they areinspired by the possibilities in exponentially impacting Singapores safety and security!

The State of Forensic Science in the US marks the inaugural TechXchange, a series of talks presented by leading scientists and experts to foster knowledge sharing and dialogue with stakeholders and community of HTXsg. Dr Henry Lee, a renowned forensic scientist and founder of Henry C. Lee Institute of Forensic Science at the University of New Haven, conducted an exclusive Zoom webinar at our invitation. A close strategic partner of the Home Team, Dr Lee has previously assisted the Police with several high-profile investigations. The session was well attended, with a number gaining new perspectives. Thank you Dr Lee for sharing with us your valuable insights! Click the link in our bio to read more about the session!

A number of us would have dabbled with Extended Reality technology through mobile games like Pokmon Go or social media apps like Snapchat. But, did you know that it can also play a part in enhancing crime-solving? If you've watched the recent Mothership video on HTXs Human Factors and Simulation Centre of Expertise work (swipe to watch an extract!), you would have noticed that Mixed Reality (MR) technology was used in Bloodstain Pattern Analysis (BPA) training. Think holographic bloodstains and computer-generated surroundings that provide a near real-life experience in training scenarios for our crime scene specialists! Find out more about this training system by clicking the link in our bio! HTXsg HTScienceandTech

The HTXsg Policing Programme Management Centre (PPMC) worked closely with the to engineer and design the Police Beacon. Through the integration of various sensors, audio and live-video technologies, the Police Beacon will allow members of the public to be connected quickly and directly with the Police in times of need, and enable interim sense-making by the Police, allowing them to better provide assistance. Prototypes of the Police Beacon will be undergoing trial in December at the Punggol Waterway Park Connector and Sengkang Riverside Park Connector. Click the link in our bio to find out more about the key technological features of the Police Beacon. HTScienceandTech OneHomeTeam

As our Chief Executive Chan Tsan puts it, "We are One HTX, no matter where we serve and what we do". We look forward to taking HTX to greater heights!Check out some of todays highlights!

In the short couple of seconds that a pistol is shot, the amount of data collected by the sensors and cameras of the Enhanced Live Firing Range System (ELFRAS) can significantly improve an officers shooting technique. Developed by HTXs Human Factors and Simulation Centre of Expertise and the , the ELFRAS, which is currently on trial, can also be used by frontline officers in other Home Team departments like the Central Narcotics Bureau, and the Immigration and Checkpoints Authority. Click the link in our bio for more information about the ELFRAS!HTXsg HTScienceandTech[Video clips: ChannelNews Asia]
